poem:
"Of Freezers and Forgotten Lights"

An opaque cube sits,
where light cannot penetrate.
Night in the freezer-
you live in obscurity
while your cousin, the fridge,
basks in the radiant glow.
O Geraldine, your inquiry
has unveiled a simple truth – 
we reserve light for the seen,
the immediate, the accessible.
But what of the unseen depths?
What of the frozen night?
